article:
Many, many years ago most people did not have beautiful books. Some families did not have
books at all. The people  _  did have books had only a few.
Instead of  reading  books, people told stories. They would remember things  _ 
happened to them and would retell these tales to friends.
Some stories you read in books today  were told  to children many years ago by their
fathers and mothers.  _  those girls and boys grew up, they, in turn, told their children the
same tales.
Sometimes the stories changed as one man told  another . That is why today there are
different beginnings and different endings to the same folk tales. You  will even find  different names
for all kinds of characters in the different versions  of the tales. In this way the stories almostseem  to be  different ones and not your favorite tales at all.
Some people  made up  stories. They would suppose  _  things which had
happened could not really have happened. Such people became  known  as storytellers.
In many of the tales, animals did the talking. In others, good men came to help bad men.
Strange, exciting things  happened . The different ideas made interesting stories.
Some of the early tales,  _  them Mother Goose verses were told in rhyme. The
poems were learned by boys and girls at home and at school.
What Mother Goose rhymes do you know and remember? Do you think there was
 really  a Mother Goose? Mother Goose stories and rhymes are  such  good ones
that we read and enjoy them today, years after they were first told.
